jobs.title: Organization Design Consultant - Relocate to Saudi Arabia
jobs.description:
Aramco energizes the world economy.

Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer.

With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco’s value to society.

Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations’ spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom’s vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.

We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as... well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.

Overview

We are seeking experienced Organization Design Consultants to join the Organizational Consulting Department (OCD).

The core functions of OCD are to provide organization design, strategy, and general management consulting services throughout the Company while ensuring alignment of consulting solutions with overall business strategy and corporate objectives, policies, and plans.

OCD consultants provide internal advisory and consulting services to deliver diverse consulting interventions that support the achievement of business initiatives and objectives.

Key Responsibilities
• Provide competent, executive-level management consulting services in diverse business lines related to organization design (OD), business strategy development, and/or other management consulting disciplines.
• Prepare presentations and other communications materials for executive audiences. Interact with and influence senior leaders in the Company to support the execution of various special projects; develop relevant content to be included in executive level presentations and reports. Design and/or facilitate workshops for senior leaders.
• Deliver results in project settings that require a grasp of cross-functional subject matter.
• Ability to write well and communicate effectively across all layers of the organization, including C-suite leaders. Above average interpersonal, facilitation, communication and collaborating skills.
• High Emotional Intelligence and political awareness. High energy with a strong work ethic and eye for business. Must be flexible and able to work in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment. Open to learning new systems and processes.
• Strong project management skills, including a proven track record of leading large, complex projects using standard project management practices and tools. Comfortable engaging partners throughout a project lifecycle.
• Apply critical thinking to a wide variety of situations, comprehend and analyze complex problems, and use well-developed arguments, persuasion, and creativity to develop solutions.
• Leverage management consulting expertise and technical knowledge to address organization change driven by business growth, technology, risk mitigation, outsourcing, business optimization, reorganizations, or transformation.
• Experienced and comfortable managing or leading large, complex projects. Skilled in working with data via Excel or other tools.
• Analytical mentality. Experience working with numbers and reporting. Experience designing/preparing data for presentation.
• Organization Design competence:
• Identify organizational design challenges and propose solutions. Perform rigorous analysis of business functions, processes, organization structures, key capabilities, and governance requirements to design organizations.
• Ability to break down silos by creating cross-functional teams to develop complete design solutions that can be effectively incorporated.
• Lead organization design projects, assisting with the development of organizational structures and/or operating models needed to support execution of the Company business strategy.
• Partner with company leaders to review current organizational structures and measures; build plans to support necessary changes.
• Assist the Corporate Advisor, Organization Design/Management Consulting with project planning. Track status and deliverables for assigned projects.
• Develop centralized tools and resources used on organization design projects.
• Stay up-to-date and informed on trends and innovations in organization design; Propose new designs, tools, and methods that will position OD to grow. Supplement technical knowledge in the areas of talent management, compensation, change management, and Human Resources processes.
• Conduct internal and external research utilizing databases, benchmarking, market surveys, and/or interviews to build analytical frameworks and conduct complex business analyses.
• Provide management consulting services to support Merger & Acquisition development and transactions, including divestments and new company formations (Joint Ventures and subsidiaries).
• Solid understanding of organizational finance (specifically workforce costing, annual budgeting, and planning processes) is a plus.

Minimum Requirements
• A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university recognized by Saudi Aramco. A Master’s degree is preferable but not essential.
• At least 10 years of management consulting experience in organizational design, strategy development, and/or other management consulting disciplines within a global company or with an international management consulting firm. Lean Six Sigma or Change Management candidates must have significant general management consulting experience in other management consulting disciplines for this senior-level management consulting position.
• This position requires in-depth knowledge of planning and managing complex management consulting projects in business improvement disciplines (e.g. organizational design, transformation projects, strategy development, etc.) ideally within the oil and gas industry.
• Demonstrated ability to use strategy, organization design, and/or process improvement management consulting methodologies, approaches, or tools.
• Proven ability to communicate effectively with excellent interpersonal, persuasion, and negotiation skills. Candidate should have excellent oral and written communication skills in English.
• Self-starter with the ability to competently and effectively complete individual tasks and work in a cross-functional team environment.
• Proven delivery experience in organizational design and/or management consulting roles. Previous experience in a large consultancy (strategy or organization design practices) is a significant plus. New hires are expected to draw on their knowledge and expertise to provide immediate value.
• Experience operating in large, multi-national corporations in a highly-matrixed, sophisticated structure; Oil and Gas experience a plus.
• Experience working across many countries and cultures. Exposure to the needs and challenges of Saudi Aramco local and global leaders.

Relevant Certifications:
• Organization Design
• Lean Six Sigma
• Data Analytics
• Change Management
• Project Management Professional (PMP

jobs.title: Management Consultant
jobs.description:
About us

The Consultant experience at The Poirier Group (TPG) is varied, challenging, and exciting! As a growing consulting firm operating throughout North America, TPG creates and executes operational strategies, business transformations, and process improvements in a variety of industries and businesses. TPG is a values-based organization that brings balance to all engagements through human alignment, effectively creating dramatic change. We are proud of our track record of 18 years exceeding client expectations. As such, this role demands a passion for delivering high-quality service and client satisfaction. We welcome you to bring your 'A' game!

TPG is one of the 2022 winners of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures from Waterstone Human Capital, recognizing organizations with strong corporate cultures contributing to high-performance. For the third year in a row, we have ranked in the Top 25 Boutique Consulting firms in North America by Vault.com. This year we also ranked in... additional categories including the "Consulting Top 50" and in the top 25 for "Quality of Life Categories" including Diversity, Overall Business Outlook, Firm Culture, Training & Mentoring, Employee Satisfaction, Firm Leadership Interaction with Clients, and more. In January 2023, we have recently been certified by Great Places to Work.

Click here to learn more about us: Careers | The Poirier Group

Job Location

The Poirier Group serves clients across Canada and the United States. Travel to client sites is required at approximately 30%. TPG's main office is located at 703 Evans Court in Etobicoke, Ontario and we currently have a hybrid model with 2 days in the office.

Opportunity

A Management Consultant is an individual contributor playing a major role in executing client commitments and projects to completion, including planning, analyzing, designing, presenting, implementing, and achieving sustainable improved performance. In way of fact-finding activities, consultants are expected to clearly identify areas of improvement, analyze and summarize data, logically structure recommendations and formulate an understandable business case, and finally execute committed initiatives based on the voice of the client. All Management Consultants work with a project team led by the Program Lead and Project Lead.

Responsibilities
• Analyze complex data and synthesize the information for effective communication with stakeholders.
• Facilitate engagements with various levels of an organization aimed at creating business plans, gap analyses, process maps, labour/work analyses, and other process improvement techniques.
• Work closely with clients to understand their needs, create strategies for change, win client support/buy-in for your recommendations, and collaborate with colleagues to transform client potential into performance
• Apply results-based problem solving to design and conceptualize client solutions based on a solid understanding of business process improvement and change management methodologies.
• Support client engagements through creating high-quality deliverables, solutions, industry best practices, and other knowledge artifacts to meet committed initiatives
• Focus on analyzing and diagnosing the client's current state, identifying improvement opportunities based on addressing root causes, architecting solutions, and implementation roadmaps across various industries.
• Develop, maintain, and strengthen client relationships through day-to-day communication and continuously help define the voice of the customer
• Develop and present strong story-telling through written and oral communication when presenting ideas
• Identify opportunities with existing clients, creating, and delivering proposals that accurately represent TPG's approach.
• Be a culture carrier supporting and growing the firm's values and culture.

Requirements
• To qualify for a TN1 Visa, a Canadian Passport is mandatory as our work is predominately throughout North America. Due to the requirements of a TN1 Visa, candidates with a work permit or with a permanent resident status do not qualify. A US Passport is an alternative.
• University Degree in Engineering, Business, Finance or Science is a requirement.
• Change Management, PMP (Project Management Professional), Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Certification, and/or CPA, CMA, CPA, is highly preferred.
• Supply Chain Management Certifications are welcomed
• 5-10 years of relevant work experience implementing operational process improvement in Retail, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Procurement, Information Technology, and/or Grocery.
• Advanced knowledge and experience with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Visio.
• Excellent data analytics in Microsoft Excel, and Power BI.

Additional Competencies
• A collaborative mentality with a positive and encouraging attitude, willing to help the team out beyond assigned duties
• Quickly grasp 'what does done look like' by understanding the client need and our commitment to deliver set-out initiatives.
• Attention to detail and construction of high-quality deliverables
• A curious and self-starter mindset, consistently looking for ways to drive value and contribute to the team
• Relationship management skills, ability to quickly initiate trusting relationships to a broad range of people
• Non-judgemental and non-defensive attitude, open to receive and give feedback
• Ability to manage stress and ambiguity, yet make sound decisions despite tight deadlines or multiple priorities
• Continuous learning to develop professionally and personally
• Proven project management/leadership skills with experience leading large continuous improvement initiatives.
• Capable of effectively managing multiple projects and assignments, both client-facing and internal.
• Up to date with the latest leading-edge solutions, methodologies, tools, trends, and innovations in business process improvement. Including but not limited to Lean, Six Sigma, Kaizen, 5S, Cause and Effect Analysis, Value-Stream Mapping, Process Mapping, Data Analysis, etc.
• Knowledgeable in process improvement techniques such as data analysis, object-oriented analysis, modelling techniques, project sizing and costing, and current state analysis/needs assessment, statistical process control charting, significance testing, etc.
• Familiar with business assessment tools (e.g., feasibility studies, business cases, cost/benefit, benchmarking, etc.).
• Superior ability to prepare and deliver compelling presentations, proposals, and reports that are accurate, error-free, and relevant.

Benefits

What we offer at TPG:
• A passionate and collaborative environment that is engaging, supportive, and energizing - allowing you to bring out your best!
• A culture that supports your growth and development by creating continuous opportunities for you to learn from the best.
• Coaching and feedback to support your consulting journey at TPG.
• Significant variety working on different teams, interesting challenges and in various industries across North America.
• Serve your community through volunteer consulting opportunities, whose causes would greatly benefit from operational efficiencies. 'Purpose Beyond Profit' is our not-for-profit initiative that works to leverage our unique business and operational skill sets to support our community in a sustainable way.

In addition, we offer:
• A competitive industry salary commensurate with experience and education. In addition, an incentive bonus plan.
• TPG covers 100% of your benefits. Our benefit package includes health, dental, employee assistance plan, vision benefits a LifeStyle Wellness Program and a Health Spending Account.
• Coaches to develop you in your goals, providing support in training and development, professional association membership, and additional competency training
• An on-site gym, sauna, and wellness room.
• A bi-annual company retreat in Collingwood, Ontario and various other company-sponsored events and activities.

Additional Information:

TPG values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. TPG is committed to providing a barrier-free pathway throughout our recruitment selection process. Please let us know if you require accommodation because of a different ability at any stage of our hiring process.

TPG's commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, religion, identity, and experience drives us forward everyday. One of the ways we keep that mandate is to ensure our interview panels during recruitment are as diverse as possible

jobs.title: Talent & Organization Management Consultant
jobs.description:
November 15 2023
Industries Consulting services

Categories Human Resources,

Toronto, ON • Full time

Job Description
We are:
Talent and Organization, and we help clients co-create the workforce of the future. How? We make decisions based on insights. We give people the tools and roadmaps to do their best work. We create digital experiences employees love. And we teach companies how to grow great, forward-thinking leaders. Our approach and our people put us at the front of the pack for talent, HR, and organizational consulting. We help clients with new skilling, talent strategy, leadership development, employee experience, change management and beyond. Visit us here to find out more about Talent and Organization.
You are:
A Consulting guru with experience in organizational design and operating model with top-flight leadership and management skills. Your expertise is in advising clients on data-driven strategies to transform their organizations so they can crush their strategic... financial, and operational goals. As a Manager, you're a natural at building and bringing out the best in teams. And you're a problem's worst nightmare, thanks to your prodigious analytical and creative chops. Communication and people skills- You have both in spades, along with a strong desire to work in a digital systems environment.
The work:
Manage teams to deliver leading practice strategies and blueprints that define the organizational design and operating model for the enterprise, as well as function-specific models across the value chain (sales, marketing, product development, R&D, finance, HR, IT, supply chain/logistics, procurement, and other services such as legal, real estate, facilities, and engineering)
Lead engagements using analytics to drive insights and design end-to-end Organizational Transformation programs (Digital, Cloud, M&A, Enterprise and Functional)
Work with senior level clients to architect future-proof, agile, and resilient organization and operating models which embrace the future of work
Partner with senior level clients to co-create organizational design alternatives test them against design criteria, and align leadership groups around design selection and implementation
Model resource and skill requirements through capacity planning using time distribution or activity analysis tools
Work with senior level clients to design governance models by facilitating senior stakeholders to implement decision making authority, accountability and responsibility to leaders and functional groups
Lead engagements with senior level clients to co-create solutions at the intersection of people, organization, business, and technology
Work with senior level clients to design transformational change strategies and programs to support the implementation of the new organization structures and operating models
Guide teams to ensure clients are positioned for long-term success with practical roadmaps for implementing organization design changes, managing change, transforming and monitoring processes, and taking remedial steps
Lead authentically and with a people-first mindset that fosters inclusivity and celebrates diversity. Mentor junior members of the team, providing them with experiences to continually learn and grow
Organize and drive business development efforts, including Statements of Work (SOW), proposal development, and client presentations
Lead and contribute to practice development initiatives including culture building, internal community involvement, capability development, recruiting, and whitepapers
show more show less
Qualifications
- 3+ years of experience in four or more of the following areas:
Transformational Change Management
Organization Design
Organization Analytics
Talent & Workforce Analytics
Strategic Workforce Planning
Enterprise Transformations
- Minimum of 5 years of consulting experience or equivalent
- Experience working with c-suite executives in co-creating operating models
- Experience designing and implementing organization structure changes
- Experience using AI tools and platforms in analyzing organizational and workforce data to drive organizational design decisions and implications (e.g., OrgVue)
- Bachelor's degree
- English is required for this position as this role will regularly interact with stakeholders across Canada, US and other countries across our Global footprint where English is the common language. Due to the significant high volume of interactions with these English-speaking stakeholders, which is inherent to this position, it is not possible to reorganize the company's activities to avoid this requirement.
Bonus points if:
At least 3 years' experience in 1 or more of the following area:
Operating Model Design
Design Thinking
Human Centered Design
Employee Experience
Culture Change
Agile Organization Development

jobs.title: Director, Management Consulting - Tech Advisory
jobs.description:
We are the leading provider of professional services to the middle market globally, our purpose is to instill confidence in a world of change, empowering our clients and people to realize their full potential. Our exceptional people are the key to our unrivaled, inclusive culture and talent experience and our ability to be compelling to our clients. You’ll find an environment that inspires and empowers you to thrive both personally and professionally. There’s no one like you and that’s why there’s nowhere like RSM.

We are looking for a Director, Management Consulting – Technology Advisory to provide strategy and advisory assistance to improve the overall effectiveness of our clients’ technology & digital needs.

Responsibilities
• Lead all client delivery activities and discovery sessions that include requirements gathering and desired workflows with clients to understand and document their business needs (i.e. budget forecasting, financial reporting, and consolidation)
• Serve as a... liaison between stakeholders and users
• Define business requirements for a number of different types of technology engagements
• Interact and communicate effectively with managers and middle management executives
• Assist the project teams through agreed upon phases on a variety of projects which could include best practices, process re-engineering, finance strategy and organizational development, business integration planning and execution, performance management software selection, design and implementation, ERP software selection, implementation, and optimization or operational and IT strategy assessments and due diligence
• Provide analysis, development and documentation of improvement opportunities
• Facilitate user workshops to gather and document business needs, requirements, weaknesses and challenges
• Continuously learn to better understand RSM's array of services, with the intent to enhance value to our clients
• Stay up to date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems and regulations
• Effectively document and communicate your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management
• Evaluate business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions
• Prioritize initiatives based on business needs and requirements
• Provide leadership, training, coaching, and guidance to junior staff
• Gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and produce useful reports
• Provide thought leadership through presentations or writing such as blogs or RSM content either individually or jointly with other RSM team members
• Network internally and externally to develop sales opportunities
• Establish yourself as a trusted advisor to clients, while managing their expectations
• Manage multiple projects and project teams to deliver exceptional client experience

Qualifications
• A minimum of 8 years of previous experience delivering information technology integration, outsourcing, and/or management consulting services
• Experience delivering IT consulting services/solutions of which encompassed strategy, people, and process, technology and infrastructure components
• Experience with ERP, CRM, financial reporting, portal, accounting systems
• Strong oral and written communication skills, including high-impact client-facing communications
• Critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills, as well as the ability to apply theoretical concepts and best practices to solve business problems
• Basic understanding of IT application lifecycle, IT general controls and methods
• Experience with project management, business process re-engineering, business intelligence software design and implementation, ERP implementation, or merger/integrations
• Experience building and maintaining client relationships and sales
• Basic understanding of Data Privacy regulations
• Familiarity with methodologies, tools, and approaches to support the practice
• Experience with various software solutions including Microsoft Project, Visio, PowerPoint and Word
• Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Management Information Systems, Computer Science or related field and/or a technology focused MBA
• Ability and willingness to travel up to 50% locally and nationally

At RSM, we offer a competitive benefits and compensation package for all our people. We support and inspire you to prioritize your wellbeing by delivering personalized, holistic programming for your physical, emotional, financial and community wellbeing. Learn more about our total rewards at https://rsmcanada.com/careers/life-at-rsm/rewards-and-benefits.html

Compensation Range: $142,500 - $237,000

jobs.title: SENIOR CHANGE MANAGEMENT CONSULTANT
jobs.description:
Job ID: 39430
• Job Category: Human Resources
• Division & Section: Transportation Services, Business Performance
• Work Location: 64 Murray Road
• Job Type & Duration: Full-time, Temporary Vacancy, 24 months
• Salary: $112,000.00-$144,200.00
• Shift Information: Monday to Friday, 35 hours per week
• Affiliation: Non-Union
• Number of Positions Open: 1
• Posting Period: 13-NOV-2023 to 11-DEC-2023

Transportation Services is looking for an experienced, knowledgeable and innovating Senior Change Management Consultant for the successful implementation of Enterprise Work Management Solution (EWMS) program.

Reporting to the Transportation Services EWMS Business Lead, you will manage and organize consulting services to Transportation Services key stakeholders in the practice areas of organizational change management, organization design and restructuring; program and service improvement, and organization development.

Transportation Services plans, constructs and manages the transportation... infrastructure within the public right-of-way, including the public realm, roads, sidewalks and traffic signals. EWMS is a transformational program to replace legacy work management systems with the objective of modernizing service delivery.

Major Responsibilities:
• Leverage organizational change management methodologies, techniques and expertise to lead the change and communication activities EWMS project.
• Provide guidance on Change Management best practices, while working collaboratively with the EWMS Program Management team, Divisional Management team, Domain SME, Project Managers, Business Lead, Business Analysts and other key stakeholders.
• Prepare and present a division communication plan, strategies for rolling out organizational change, train staff and presentations.
• Lead stakeholder management, including identifying stakeholders, conducting stakeholder impact assessment, assessing change readiness and outlining actions to support new behaviors as required.
• Lead the design and delivery of training programs including documenting business training needs.
• Develop a targeted organizational change management plan that supports and ensures stakeholder engagement, leadership alignment, communication and training plans based on stakeholder assessment for the adoption, and realization of the program benefits.
• Develop materials for socializing organizational change with Senior Divisional Management and executive leadership.
• Communicate to a variety of stakeholders in a manner that addresses their needs and facilitates the acceptance of the proposed organizational change.
• Provide input to the creation, or modification, of project artifacts such as project charter, schedule, risk/issue logs, cost management plan and project communication plans
• Provide input to the implementation planning of the EWMS.
• Consolidate all findings, and recommendations, with respect to communication and feedback for the Business Lead.
• Provide required artifacts in an organized and timely manner for review by the Business Lead.
• Bring analysis and conclusions forward to the client/stakeholders, chair meetings and promote systematic discussion.
• Support the Business Lead in assessing and devising solutions from a pragmatic and objective perspective.
• Work in support of project steering committees and attend interdivisional organizational change management working groups.
• Assume a lead change management role during the transition phase of projects.
• Contribute to the development and implementation of strategic organization design at the divisional levels.
• Assist in the assessment and analysis of corporate organization effectiveness issues, conducts relevant studies and prepares confidential reports with respect to program and service delivery changes; management policies, systems, processes and practices; restructuring; and organization change.
• Lead and/or support the program and divisional project teams in the identification of a range of options for operations, policies, information systems and management practices; assessment of the implications and viability of each option; and recommend changes to support management priorities and functions.
• Promote organization learning and takes steps to orchestrate change through the program and divisional projects.
• Foster and maintain cooperative working relationships within, and external to, the organization; establish and maintain contact with professionals in related fields to ensure skills, knowledge and practice are current.

Key Qualifications:

Your application for the role of Senior Change Management Consultant should describe your qualifications as they relate to:
• University degree in Business Administration/Communication, Public Administration or in a field related to change management.
• Extensive experience working in public sector (preferably in municipal transportation services) as a leader of change and transition.
• Extensive experience in practical and methodological application of organizational change management principles and processes with a demonstrated track record of completion of complex, large, transformative projects with competing timelines.
• Extensive experience developing and executing change management activities including effective communications, develop and deliver training program, communicating the change story effectively with multiple stakeholders.
• Extensive experience planning and leading change, monitoring change progress and reporting on the successes of change using quantifiable metrics.
• Extensive experience providing a high level of coordination in a diverse, project-based environment.
• Ability to develop organizational change management tactics to help shift mindset, behaviors, and achieve results through program and divisional activities, communication and leadership messages.
• Ability to work in an environment where multiple stakeholders may be resistant to change, and need effective communications strategies to maximize engagement and minimize stakeholders change resistance.
• Formal Organizational Change Management certification/accreditation is considered an asset.
• Ability to communicate effectively, excellent written and verbal communication skills, including negotiation, influencing and presentation skills; strong ability to facilitate small to large sized groups and discussions.
• Excellent organization and project management skills
• Ability to work independently as well as within a team environment.
• Extensive experience using Microsoft Office Suite and Microsoft SharePoint proficiency are considered assets.

The City of Toronto's Workplace Modernization Program is re-imagining how we work in our workplace. Its vision is to provide flexibility to our employees around how we work and where we work. It will also support a better work-life balance, improved job satisfaction and employee engagement. Improving the work experience is at the core of this program and everyone plays a significant role in its realization. We have introduced the Hybrid Work Program which supports a more modern and flexible way of working. The hybrid approach will allow us to keep the best of remote work while integrating the important aspects of in-person collaboration and team work.

The hybrid work model is a new way of working that, where operationally feasible, allows employees to work some days in the office and some days remotely. It is supported by the Remote Work Policy. In the hybrid work model, People Leaders will determine remote work arrangements with their team that best support operational requirements.

Note to Internal Full-Time and Part-Time City of Toronto Employees

City of Toronto employees must apply to full-time or part-time employment opportunities posted on the City's Internal Job Posting Portal.

Equity, Diversity and Inclusion

The City is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace culture of inclusiveness that reflects the diverse residents that we serve. Learn more about the City’s commitment to employment equity.

Accommodation

The City of Toronto is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive organization. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require Code-protected accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to meet your needs. Disability-related accommodation during the application process is available upon request. Learn more about the City’s Hiring Policies and Accommodation Process

jobs.title: Executive Program Consultant
jobs.description:
Join us as a Senior Executive Program Consultant in the cutting-edge field of Digital Health Interoperability (DHI). As a key player in our leadership team, you will drive strategic initiatives, mentor top-tier professionals, and contribute to the realization of a connected health system.

As a seasoned executive, your expertise will shape the evolution of our DHI program, contributing to its success and fostering a culture of excellence. You will play a pivotal role in accelerating the maturity of our product portfolio and guiding the DHI Leadership Team in achieving Year 1 deliverables.

Roles and Responsibilities

1. Strategic Leadership:
• Cultivate a collaborative and high-performing culture within the DHI team.
• Advise the Strategy & Delivery Office (SDO) for effective execution of the DHI Internal Strategic Plan.
• Provide oversight to SDO leaders in strategy, business planning, and delivery.
• Establish and enhance program processes and capabilities to drive operational... excellence.

2. Product Management Excellence:
• Mentor DHI Product Managers in executing each stage of the product lifecycle.
• Ensure effective governance, monitoring, and reporting of product performance.
• Mitigate risks and issues across the product portfolio with strategic solutions.

3. Program Oversight:
• Guide teams in delivering initiatives/projects on time, within budget, and in line with interoperability standards.
• Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies.
• Foster collaboration and coordination among project teams for successful outcomes.

4. Performance Measurement and Evaluation:
• Define internal KPIs and metrics to assess the performance and impact of each DHI pillar.
• Collaborate with cross-functional leads to establish comprehensive performance indicators.
• Monitor and evaluate portfolio performance against established targets.

Qualifications and Skills
• Proven track record as an executive leader in program design, delivery, and large-scale transformation.
• Expertise in mentoring and guiding teams to achieve strategic goals.
• Strong understanding of digital health interoperability and product management.
• Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

Why Join Us:
• Be part of a dynamic organization driving innovation in digital health.
• Shape the future of healthcare interoperability.
• Competitive compensation and benefits package.

jobs.title: Consulting Analyst
jobs.description:
Why ProLytics?

At ProLytics Consulting Group, we work with our clients to improve their financial and business analytics systems and processes. Our experienced team is committed to working closely with each customer to adopt and deliver end-end solutions and process improvements to drive performance and growth.

We are looking to build our Professional Services team with open-minded, entrepreneurial, and collaborative individuals. As a Consulting Analyst, you will explore your consulting passion and develop industry skills that will enable you to thrive no matter what your future career path holds. In this role, you will gain direct experience working alongside our experienced consulting team on client engagements throughout the project life cycle.

Roles and Responsibilities

We are looking for a Consulting Analyst to join our Consulting and Professional Services team. This is a full-time entry-level role supporting client project delivery and handling various project tasks... including:
• Conducting formal or information customer training or coaching
• Participating in requirements and discovery sessions
• Configuring software solutions to meet customers’ unique business needs
• Building input interfaces and reporting
• Creating moderate ETL and integration routines and data processes
• Supporting customer communications and project status tracking

Qualifications
• Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, IT, Finance, Business Administration, or any related fields
• Current students: Must be in their final year of study in September 2022, graduating between December 2022 to September 2023
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office (especially Microsoft Excel)
• Familiarity working with Software Implementation and Deployment Life Cycles
• Excellent Customer Communication Skills
• Strong Critical Thinking, Analytics, and Problem-Solving Skills
• A proven performer who can work independently and, in a team setting
• Worked with Finance teams in Financial Reporting and Planning Analysis
• Knowledge of Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, and/or other data visualization tools would be an asset
• Knowledge or experience working with OLAP, Relational/Non-Relational Databases would be an asset

How To Apply

You must submit a cover letter and resume for your application to be considered for an interview. Prospective candidates will be required to complete a digital assessment during the interview process.

We thank all candidates for submitting their applications however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

For inquiries, contact talent@prolyticsgroup.com for more information

Job Description & Summary

Join our community of solvers in cultivating a collaborative workplace driven by unique perspectives. We’re proud PwC Canada advances a culture that helps everyone thrive. It's one of the reasons we're recognized as a top employer in Canada. As you build a career with purpose and build meaningful connections that’ll last a lifetime, you'll work with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to help solve important problems, powered by the latest technology, to turn today's ideas into tomorrow's solutions.

PwC Canada is committed to cultivating an inclusive, hybrid work environment - one that is collaborative, supportive and productive. We work in-person and virtually, as is best suited for our clients, teams and people. We want you to be intentional with your work, how you do it and where it’s done. PwC offices are... hubs of connectivity and learning. We strongly encourage our people to prioritize in-person work, whether it’s in the office or at a client site. This means we expect you to be in-person (either with clients or in the office) at least half of your time.

We know that hybrid work is all about balance, and capturing the benefits of in-person work is essential to your growth at the firm. Exact expectations for your team can be discussed with your interviewer.

What you’ll create and do

You’ll join as an Associate you’ll help organizations of all shapes and sizes grow faster and work smarter, helping to solve problems that matter. Whatever issues you’re resolving on their behalf, you’ll work with inspiring leaders who’ll help you achieve your goals and be your best. You'll quickly develop business acumen, as well as project management, coaching and core consulting skills.

When you join us, you’ll be engaged in a structured program that’s focused on ensuring your rapid learning and success. By aligning you based on your skills and abilities to one of PwC's core consulting teams, you’ll have the opportunity to live your potential starting on Day 1. This will also ensure that you're part of a community with the potential to work across teams to allow you to work on a variety of projects.

You’ll also have the opportunity to gain knowledge across industries and sectors including Financial Services, Energy, Utilities, Mining and Industrial Products, Government & Public Sector and Telco, Media, Transportation & Consumer Markets.

What you’ll bring to this role:

With connectivity being a key enabler of our strategy, our objective is to become the most connected firm - connected to our clients, our communities and to each other. PwC follows an Activity Based Work model, where our PwC professionals engage in a diverse range of activities from our offices, from client sites, or our homes.
• Enrolled in or completed post-secondary education
• An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work
• A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences and working alongside diverse people and perspectives
• Strong written and verbal communication skills to articulate new ideas
• Highly detail oriented with excellent organizational and analytical skills; an ability to think broadly and to ask questions about data, facts and other information to deliver quality to our clients
• Share and collaborate effectively with others, building relationships which are genuine and rooted in trust
• Ability to easily adapt and prioritize, demonstrating project management skills to handle changing priorities
• Examples of alignment with PwC Values: Acting with Integrity, Working Together, Care, Reimagine the Possible and Make a Difference
• You’ll be comfortable travelling to cities across Canada (when deemed safe to do so by applicable public health or regulatory authorities and PwC)
• This role requires that you are legally entitled to work for PwC in Canada for the intended duration of the offer/contract.

Note: We only allow you to submit one application; however you are able to select a second and third office preference.

Why you’ll love working with us

At PwC Canada, our solvers are supported through meaningful rewards, meaningful connections, meaningful work, and meaningful growth. Thrive in work and life through our diverse, inclusive and flexible culture, powered by the latest tech. Learn what it means to be a part of The New Equation .

jobs.title: IT Technical Consultant
jobs.description:
WORK ILLUSTRATION:

Reporting to the Senior manager, IT Portfolio Management (Customer Care and Metering), the IT Technical Consultant provides technical and analytical support, performs trouble shooting functions, implements processes, systems or projects that contribute to the efficient and effective technical delivery in the operational areas of Information Technology.

The incumbent is expected to behave ethically and follow the established code of business conduct, policies and internal control procedures, laws and regulations governing Toronto Hydro.

Toronto Hydro has implemented a mandatory vaccination requirement for all its employees. Proof of full vaccination will be required upon receiving a conditional offer of employment. Toronto Hydro will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who cannot be vaccinated due to disability or any other ground protected by the Ontario Human Rights Code.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Analyzes business/functional/technical requirements... and specifications for the IT Systems
• Installs, configures, maintains, enhances Information Technology systems software and hardware in accordance with corporate and security standards, for defined area of expertise
• Supports and responds to service outages and incidents
• Supports Information Technology System testing, deployment and upgrade activities
• Creates and maintains documentation to support IT Systems and Processes
• Identifies problems and opportunities for improvement of IT Services, systems or processes
• Troubleshoots and maintains IT systems to improve reliability, capacity, performance
• Performs administrative routines associated with the position
• Familiar with supporting secure print management solutions
• Experience supporting IT asset management tools
• Experience evaluating software licensing and support contracts
• Knowledgeable in ITIL processes and best practices for IT Service Management
• Experienced in executing projects with both Waterfall and Agile methodology

REQUIREMENTS:
• Post-secondary Degree/ Diploma (University or College)
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in Information Technology
• Experience with web technology, content management platform and mobile app development in both BA/BSA/PM capacity
• Knowledge of AMI Head End Systems such as Connexo, MV90, PrimeRead
• Knowledge of MDM Systems such as EnergyIP, IEE, PrimeRead, MDMR
• Experience with integrating platforms such as WebSphere AIP, IBM Integration Bus, IBM ACE, MOVEit to integrate Head End, MDM, CIS and Outage Management Systems. Ability to support existing integration as well as design of new interfaces to meet new business needs.
• Experience with application patching of AMI Software to ensure the systems are up to date in terms of security and business needs.
• Proficient with SQL, Java, Shell Scripting, Batch Scripts.
• Proficient with Windows / Linux / AIX
• Understanding of smart metering concepts – intervals, registers, demand, interval billing, time-of-use billing
• Understanding of device communications – TCP/IP, PSTN, wireless mesh networks.
• Ability to work in team environment
• Ensures measures are in place to track achievements
• Innovation and creative problem solving
• Effective approach to risk management
• Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
• Demonstrates safety awareness
• Electrical utility experience an asset

Toronto Hydro has introduced a Hybrid Work Arrangement. This position allows for remote work up to three days per week, based on business needs. Employees will be required to come onsite on those days when they are involved in activities that they or their leader feel are better conducted in person. You are expected to live in Ontario and within reasonable commuting distance of the office.

jobs.title: MC Consultant/Sr Consultant, May 2024 Intern (GTA)
jobs.description:
Overview

Please note that you are limited to one application during the recruitment period as we ask you to think ahead of what office and service line you are most interested in. This position is for a 4-month intern/co-op term.

At KPMG, you’ll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause: turning insight into opportunity.

 

The opportunity:

We are seeking talented and energetic candidates to join our Advisory, Management Consulting team as an Intern/Co-op Consultant/Senior Consultant working in our Toronto practice starting in Spring (May) 2024. Positions are available in the following service lines:
• Operations 
• Customer 
• Finance Transformation 
• Enterprise Performance Management 
• Technology Strategy and Transformation
• Supply Chain
• People & Change

What you will do

Operations 

The Operations team at KPMG supports clients in the Financial Services sector (Banking, Wealth & Asset Management, Insurance, Private Equity, Pensions... the Public Sector and the Technology, Media and Telecommunication sectors with a range of services: strategic planning, growth & omni-channel strategy, Target Operating Model (TOM) design, process improvement/redesign, cost optimization/value realization and accounting/regulatory change programs. As part of the Operations team, you will help clients perform current situation assessments/diagnostics, visioning/target state design as well as develop roadmaps and support implementation. 

Customer 

The KPMG Customer Team creates best-in-class digitally enabled customer experiences (CX) as part of our clients’ wider organizational strategy. We operate across seven key service domains: CX design, growth strategy, digital advisory, e-commerce advisory, innovation, NextGen strategy, and contact centre advisory. Our projects are about understanding strategy, technology, design, and process through the lens of a digital experience. We would love to hear from individuals who are passionate about helping clients reshape their business around the customer to create a truly connected and profitable enterprise. 

Finance Transformation 

An effective finance function needs to be aligned to the business strategy and should provide agile financial analysis and insight to support corporate decision making, while also meeting legal and regulatory requirements as a given. With a global network of professionals working in KPMG member firms around the world, Finance Transformation collaborates closely with CFOs and other finance leaders to help maximize the finance function's performance and empower them to become insightful business partners.  We focus on a variety of areas surrounding our “Finance of the Future” vision to drive strategy and implementation across finance operations optimization, target operating model redesign, financial technology transformation, and regulatory compliance transformation. 

Enterprise Performance Management 

The Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) practice works with finance functions to empower them to become more insightful and true business partners.  We are trusted advisors in budgeting, planning and forecasting, close and consolidation, reporting and analytics with a particular focus on implementing technology solutions to enable these processes.

Technology Strategy and Transformation

The TST team at KPMG advises clients on how new technology will impact their business and delivers innovative end-to-end digital transformation. We work with digital and functional leaders across industries and sectors to define their vision for digital transformation, develop tailored technology strategies, align with IT assets to be more customer centric, and create and execute implementation plans that drive business value. Please note that for Technology Strategy and Transformation, applicants should demonstrate a clear interest or have a background in technology.

Supply Chain

Amidst ever-changing technological, economic and regulatory challenges, varying industries need one thing: effective supply chain management to accelerate their corporate growth strategies, increase operational efficiency, and offer new and differentiated value to their customers.  KPMG understands the complexities of designing and managing supply chains, and our strategic business approach helps create and sustain bottom-line value across the extended supply chain -- from suppliers to customers. A career in KPMG’s Supply Chain services can be extremely rewarding.

People & Change

We advance our client’s business performance by helping to shape and navigate the important people dynamics related to the transformation of work, capabilities, and behaviours. We assist our clients with strategic alignment, workforce shaping, embedding inclusion and diversity, capability building & learning, digital HR transformation and culture shifting. With experience in all industries, as well as both the private and public sectors, our People and Change practice helps organizations drive value and enhance success by optimizing their talent agenda and activating their most valuable resource, their people.

What you bring to the role

FOR CONSULTANT LEVEL:
• You are enrolled in a university degree program (we will be considering candidates from a spectrum of programs such as Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Commerce, Arts, etc.)
• You are currently in your first, second, or third year of study
• You are a highly motivated individual, enthusiastic about taking on a variety of challenges and opportunities
• You have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal 
• You have a strong academic record 
• You have the ability to work independently without supervision 
• You have strong problem solving and analytical abilities, as well as a proven track record of successfully dealing with competing priorities and deadlines under pressure 
• You have a strong sense of personal accountability 
• You have an entrepreneurial drive, and are a creative problem solver 

 

FOR SENIOR CONSULTANT LEVEL:

Senior Consultants usually join Management Consulting with significant work experience, coming from an MBA, PhD, MD, JD or other advanced degree program. Senior Consultant are expected to be able to come into the Management Consulting team and immediately make a significant impact. Those coming from undergraduate degrees or master’s degrees with less than 2 years’ work experience should consider applying for the Consultant position. 
• You are a highly motivated individual, enthusiastic about taking on a variety of challenges and opportunities 
• You have strong interpersonal skills and professional maturity; demonstrated ability to effectively interact and build relationships with a diverse group of clients and colleagues 
• You have strong problem solving and analytical abilities, as well as a proven track record of successfully dealing with competing priorities and deadlines under pressure 
• You have an entrepreneurial drive, and are a creative problem solver 
• You have a strong academic record from your undergraduate or master’s degree 
• You are able to support general project management and oversee the planning, scheduling and completion of objectives and engagements, asset development and other initiatives. 

All applications must be received no later than Thursday, November 30th at 11:59 pm ET. Our online application system will allow you to include up to five documents without losing your formatting. Applications can be addressed to Hiring Manager and should include:
• Cover letter
• Resume
• Electronic copy of your most recent transcript and/or GPA
• Other relevant documents (i.e. GMAT score)

KPMG individuals Deliver Impact | Seek Growth | Inspire Trust and understand that a diverse workforce enables us to deepen relationships and strengthen our business.

Providing you with the support you need to be at your best

jobs.title: Senior Marketing Consultant
jobs.description:
What We Offer

At GDA, you can build a career out of making things happen! GDA Capital is a financial institution that provides vertically integrated merchant banking and capital markets services to institutional investors and disruptive technology companies. We are the trusted advisor that bridges the gap between the institutional capital market and disruptive technologies.

We have an exciting opportunity for a talented Senior Marketing Consultant to join our company. The Senior Marketing Consultant shall be primarily responsible as the first point of contact between GDA’s advisory clients and the rest of the team. This will involve a lot of marketing strategy including the entire creation of go to market strategies, as well the coordination of internal and external teams during the execution phases. This role would be ideally suited to a blockchain-savvy individual able to self-manage and work independently and remotely, set priorities and efficiently manage day to day processes... with a high degree of accuracy and grit.

Responsibilities & Expectations

Based anywhere in North America or Europe and reporting to the CEO, you will have direct contact with all 20+ employees at the firm. You will hold the highest advisory marketing role, giving you the opportunity to take on a leadership role and to develop and optimize many of our existing marketing and raise processes. We expect to hire a team to help support the growth of the department over the next quarters. Here is a breakdown of what will be expected of you.

Senior Marketing Consultant:
• Create full go to market strategies for our client and execute them alongside the client; depending on the client, the budgets range from five figures to eight figures.
• Establish project management processes using a CMS such as Asana to ensure no task falls through the cracks
• Manage existing marketing team to ensure proper execution of campaigns
• Create and monitor paid marketing campaigns
• Build out funnel strategies and implement them for clients
• Draft bi-weekly reports for all clients going over sprint periods
• Regularly strategize, update and maintain organizational charts.
• Support the bi-annual Performance Management processes through manager/employee system support, tracking and reporting on status of completion.
• Continuously develop and close global partnerships with PR firms, influencers, marketing agencies, design agencies, event management agencies, cryptocurrency exchanges, and social media communities - adding them to a well-organized readily available partner database.

Sales & Business Development:
• Help with the onboarding process of new clients
• Support the sales department to help close new clients by offering marketing expertise
• Coordinate communication and education sessions to employees and/or managers for plans and programs related to internal marketing
• Intern marketing development program in partnership with Tier 1 Universities

Required Qualifications
• Undergraduate degree, preferably in marketing or business
• Located in North America is highly preferred
• 4+ years of post-undergraduate or post-graduate work experience leading at-scale performance marketing programs for digital agencies or client marketing organizations. Preferably in a mid-to-large-sized corporate environment; in banking, finance or blockchain industry
• Excellent computer skills including advanced knowledge and competency with Microsoft Excel
• Knowledge and experience in setting up and implementing company-wide project management tools, such as Asana
• Ability to manage a global remote team, and to handle multiple projects/ clients and marketing campaigns simultaneously
• Knowledge and experience in the blockchain and/or traditional financial markets space is a plus.
• Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information and issues with tact and diplomacy.
• Exceptional organizational skills
• Knowledge in establishing and developing remote work processes and a relevant remote work culture.
• Detail oriented with the ability to check documents for accuracy and communicate detailed changes.
• Strong interest in coaching and mentoring team members
• Highly skilled in learning on the job and continuously learning
• Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
• Mature, professional, driven, empathetic.

Compensation

We offer competitive salaries and are committed to see our employees succeed.

Salary Range: 75K - 100K CAD

Bonus: Discretionary

Stock Options Plan: Company-wide
• Why Global Digital Assets (GDA) ? *

GDA is one of the fastest growing boutique merchant banks in Canada. The level of growth that is expected in the coming years is staggering, and we need the right person to come on board to help support the growth of our token advisory department.

The qualities we value most are ownership and teamwork; everyone pulls together to give our best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting long term career possibilities are available for the driven youthful leader that joins us as our first Senior Marketing Consultant.
• Joining GDA today means joining a team of ambitious and caring individuals. Become a key part of our growth by applying today. *

GDA Capital focuses on Financial Services and Blockchains. Their company has offices in Toronto. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees.

You can view their website at https://gda.capital or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn

jobs.title: Senior Consultant
jobs.description:
Senior Consultant (Underground Mining)
Sudbury, ON, Canada

SRK Consulting is an independent, international consulting practice, providing globally integrated consulting services to the international mining and metals sector.

We are seeking a Senior Consultant (Underground Mining).

Description of Responsibilities:

We are looking for an Senior Consultant (Underground Mining) to join our mining team in our Sudbury or Toronto office.

The successful candidate will provide technical support and focused consulting advice on underground mining projects for North American and international clients. The work will typically include contribution to technical studies, mine scheduling, mine design, and stope design. You may also be asked to support senior staff in due diligence work, operational assistance, and project management. There will be opportunity and expectation to continuously develop your technical skills and industry knowledge to further assist the SRK Ontario team, with offices... located both in Sudbury and Toronto.

An important aspect of working for SRK is the individual growth of your consulting skills within the broader global consulting group. SRK encourages all consultants to grow their consultancy under the broader SRK umbrella. As such, the successful applicant will be encouraged to establish and build a client network in collaboration with the Ontario mining team.

Essential Requirements:
• Bachelor of Science or Engineering in mining or equivalent degree such as geological engineering or geotechnical engineering with emphasis on mining
• Minimum 7 years of experience in mine design and planning
• High level of proficiency in underground mine planning software suite such as Deswik
• Mining operational experience with working knowledge of resource block models, stope optimizer software, CAD tools and scheduling software
• Advance level of technical skills in chosen engineering discipline
• Registration as a professional engineer, or eligibility to obtain it
• Self-starter with strong inter-personal communication and writing skills
• Ability and desire to support and/or collaborate with other technical specialists

In return for considering a future with us, we offer:
• An attractive compensation package.
• Diversity of projects and clients within a non-hierarchical consultancy environment.
• Opportunity to purchase shares in the company; the SRK Group is an independent group, owned by its employees.

Applicants should respond by submitting their CV online by clicking the button below. The candidates under consideration will be contacted directly, no phone calls please

Spanning several cities across Canada and USA, Jarvis presents a unique engagement model, synthesizing our expertise in global collaboration with diverse thinking and our cutting-edge talent innovation hubs. This enables us to attract top talent and rapidly grow as we co-create innovative solutions.

Our focus on community engagement, diversity and our values-based culture has enabled us to become one of Canada's fastest-growing companies. Our obsession with world-class customer engagement, operational efficiency, and the strength of our solutions has enabled us to become one of Canada's most trusted partners.

The Opportunity

The world of technology is rapidly evolving through innovation and cutting-edge technologies. As we move into the future, we believe in keeping up with relevant technologies and in building that future ourselves. Our greatest assets are our people; at... Jarvis, we value imagination and curiosity as much as capability and skill.

As a Senior Technical Recruiter, you will be responsible for working directly with Jarvis’ clients and consultants, focusing on nurturing professional relationships and fulfilling hiring needs.

Job Responsibilities:
• Proactively seek and recruit qualified candidates for contract and permanent positions
• Build and manage relationships with candidates, meeting regularly to understand and support their specific needs
• Champion best practices and processes as they relate to the recruitment life cycle

What You Bring:

• Strong business acumen and decision-making skills
• Exceptional oral and written communication and presentation skills

• Proven sales track record and working within a KPI-driven environment
• Experience managing a portfolio of prospects and maintaining excellent rapport
• Good creative problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate with a team
• Technical proficiency in working with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and CRM

What We Offer:

• Generous vacation and benefits
• Convenient downtown location minutes from the subway
• A dynamic and entrepreneurial environment with opportunities for growth and advancement
• A flat organizational structure in which your voice is heard and your perspective is valued
• Highly competitive compensation

What Keeps Us Here?
• Culture and values are integral at Jarvis. Our vision of Equalizing Opportunity and Maximizing Potential enables us to build a diverse and inclusive community. We encourage everyone to bring their authentic selves to work, every day. We reward curiosity and innovative solutions while empowering our employees to discover endless possibilities.

Expect to attend events such as quarterly socials, holiday parties, charity events, and more casually, in-office/virtual events like lunch & learns, trivia and movie nights, hackathons, and many more hosted by Jarvis throughout the year.

Jarvis Consulting Group is committed to developing a barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. We are committed to equality in the workplace and to growing a welcoming and inclusive team. We encourage applications from Indigenous persons, people belonging to racialized communities, and people of all sexual orientations and genders, and will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability or age. Jarvis is committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

jobs.title: Management Consulting Associate
jobs.company: Partners In Performance International Pty Ltd
jobs.description:
Partners in Performance is a global management consulting firm with a focus on human performance and working alongside client partners to make change happen. We've got offices in Australia, New Zealand, Africa, North and South America, the UK and Europe but prefer to spend as little time in them as possible. Instead, we work alongside our clients to unleash their potential and deliver lasting impact that you hardly ever achieve by sitting in a boardroom.

What new Associates can expect when they join Partners in Performance

The Associate role is a frontline change agent for Partners in Performance clients. You are the primary source of reliable data and high-quality analysis, providing the fact base the improvement team uses to make decisions in real time.

Other responsibilities include:

· You coach client analysts and line managers, sharing your skills and building relationships across the client site, using your network to ensure improvement plans are firmly based on the... real-world clients operate in.

· Your key responsibility is to provide rigor and accuracy to the improvement effort. As the chief source of insight based on the data you work with, you facilitate the prioritization of improvement opportunities and use root cause analysis to help resolve day-to-day issues with implementation.

· You directly support client Idea owners, providing technical and analytical support to ensure improvement ideas are successful.

· You recognize when ideas are under or over-performing relative to expectations, and you're the primary source for validating the benefit stream generated by these ideas.

· You draw on and develop your leadership skills to help build the client organization's "wiring" to ensure a culture of continuous improvement sustains the improvement effort; by doing this, you ensure that the PIP methodology becomes part of the way your client does business, long after the PIP engagement is finished.

Associate key competencies

To be a successful consultant at Partners in Performance, you must be an outstanding academic performer and dynamic, passionate, and prepared to roll up your sleeves and work inside our clients' businesses. You need to care about people and developing them, as coaching is a big part of our success.

What you will need to become a member of the Partners in Performance consulting team:

· Undergraduate degree from a top-tier university with excellent results (distinction average)

· Excellent problem-solving skills, including analytics

· Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to coach, influence, and build trust with peers

· Demonstrated passion for results

· Must be fluent in English

· Excellent communication skills, including the ability to respond clearly to hard questions under pressure and to use visual tools without assistance to assist in communicating insights

· Above average knowledge of PowerPoint and Excel

What you will learn at Partners in Performance

At Partners in Performance, you will learn both the traditional management consulting toolkit plus the Partners in Performance business transformation methodologies; you will be coached to be able to coach and develop clients and colleagues; and you will participate in a wide range of formal and informal training opportunities. You will acquire many skills to position yourself for a future leadership position.

Other requirements:

Right to work in Canada or the United States is required and candidates need to have a preparedness to travel, including internationally.

Have a look at the career section for further insights –

Partners in Performance embraces diversity and inclusiveness. It's a part of our culture and has been a steady focus since we started our firm over 20 years ago. If you enjoy working in a fast-paced and vibrant environment and are passionate about making a real impact, we look forward to hearing from you as we continue our exciting growth trajectory.Interested?

$104,000 - $115,000 semi monthly

We treasure diversity of all kinds and have done since we opened for business more than 27 years ago.

jobs.title: Digital Strategy Managing Consultant (Toronto)
jobs.description:
Job Description

IBM partners with business leaders to reimagine their future….

We are seeking talented and highly motivated technology strategy consultant to join our fast-growing Digital Strategy practice within Global Business Services.
IBM Global Business Services is a leader in global transformation, and there is no better place to launch or further your career. World-class learning opportunities, mentoring and a flexible work environment—you will find a wealth of opportunities within IBM to create the career you’ve always imagined.
Be part of an innovative team of strategy consultants that help CEOs and the broader C-suite rethink their businesses and develop strategies that drive growth. We help senior executives determine where to compete, how to differentiate, and how to innovate business models by taking advantage of digital and emerging technologies. A successful candidate will have experience consulting to large enterprises in one or more of the following areas: Digital... and/or Emerging Technology Strategy, Enterprise Agility, Innovation Enablement or Data Strategy.
We ask bold questions. We use analytics to find unique opportunities and help our clients think differently. We develop strategies that are supported by robust business cases to ensure benefits are realized. We design strategies through a digital lens and leverage the vast range of capabilities within IBM to help our clients succeed.

As a Managing Consultant, your responsibilities will include:
• Leading a multi-disciplinary team of talented consultants
• Supporting business development activities such as proposal development
• Contributing to the growth and eminence of the practice by supporting thought leadership and practice development activities
• Being part of a team that helps our clients build a new vision for their company
• Helping our clients explore disruptive strategies that create business value
• Promoting IBM’s unique value proposition in the market

Intrigued? We invite you to explore this unique opportunity.

To learn more about our Digital Strategy Practice, click here.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
• 6 years of general consulting (or other equivalent business experience)
• 3 years working for a top tier strategy consulting firm developing enterprise strategies for clients and leading strategy engagements or equivalent experience (e.g., Tech Strategy, Capability Modeling, Business and Data Architecture, Agile / DevOps Transformation)
• 1 year of experience developing proposals and responding to Requests for Proposals (RFPs)
• 1 years of experience incorporating design thinking and creative approaches to problem solving and strategy formulation
• 2 years of industry experience in at least one industry (e.g., Financial Services, Consumer, Industrial and Distribution)
• Willingness to travel (domestically and globally) up to 4 days a week
• Fluent in English
• Eligible for security clearance
·

Preferred Tech and Prof Experience
• 8 years of general consulting (or other equivalent business experience)
• 5 years working for a top tier strategy consulting firm developing enterprise strategies for clients and leading strategy engagements (or equivalent experience (e.g., Tech Strategy, Capability Modeling, Business and Data Architecture, Agile / DevOps Transformation)
• 2 years of experience developing proposals and responding to Requests for Proposals (RFPs)
• 2 years of experience incorporating design thinking and creative approaches to problem solving and strategy formulation
• Agile certification (e.g., Scrum, SAFe, LeSS, Kanban and other scaling models)
• TOGAF or equivalent certification
• 3 years of industry experience in at least one industry (e.g., Financial Services, Consumer, Industrial and Distribution)
• Willingness to travel (domestically and globally) up to 4 days a week
• Eligible for security clearance

EO Statement
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
